page.title: 04FARMING INTRODUCTION
page.content: Five farms in the area were surveyed as a sample - Shielhill, Craighill, North Powrie, Whitewalls and Moatmill. The largest is Shielhill with 210 hectares but this does not include 36 hectares owned by this farm on the Sidlaws for summer grazing and land which lay off the surveyed block. The average farm size is around 100 hectares. All are mixed farms with emphasis on grain. A special commercial venture is the{PIGGERY}at Muir of Pert using part of the disused airfield.{CHICKEN}rearing is also done on part of the airfield. There are a number of{SMALLHOLDINGS}in the area. This was land bought by the Government in the 1930's and leased to local people to help employment. They are now too small to be economically worked. Some have been amalgamated - others used for building.
